description.narrative: Our Voices Our Futures (OVOF) will use capacity-building and convenings among feminist movements to strengthen and build movements within countries and across regions, while also link feminist movements to relevant actors, such as internet rights’ movements, Dutch allies and progressive policymakers. OVOF believes in strengthening movements from within, to create more inclusive, powerful and resilient movements. To influence laws and policies at national and international levels, OVOF sees this as the only sustainable mitigation strategy in relation to the increasing power of anti-rights and anti-gender forces

title.narrative: 1.2 Mainstream women’s, human rights and feminist organisations increasingly work with structurally silenced women and their organisations to pursue a rights based agenda and advocate for SSW rights.

1.2.1 Number of initiatives developed by mainstream women's, human rights and feminist organisations and activists to strengthen the presence of SSW to participate in global, national and local policy and legal spaces.

comment.narrative: Number of mainstream women's, feminist and human rights organisations in Kenya and Uganda that have meaningfully engaged SSWs in their work.
2 initiatives by mainstream women's, feminist and human rights organisations in Kenya and Uganda that have visibly involved SSWs.

UHAI held the 16th meeting of her Peer Grants Committee (1 meeting) which awarded grants to organisations led by SSWs in Kenya and Uganda to support advocacy at national level for respect of human rights of SSWs in online and offline spaces.

At least 2 initiatives developed by mainstream women's, human rights and feminist organisations and activists to strengthen the presence of SSW to participate in global, national and local policy and legal spaces.

title.narrative: Number of feminist organisations, women’s rights and sexual rights CSOs and movements with enhanced skills and capacity to influence legal and policy processes and integrate feminist and human rights perspectives into their advocacy.

comment.narrative: At least 2 feminist organisations, women’s rights and/or sexual rights CSOs and movements in Kenya and Uganda with enhanced skills and capacity to influence legal and policy processes and integrate feminist and human rights perspectives into their advocacy.

In 2021 UHAI funded 14 SSW organisations in Kenya and 9 SSW organisations Uganda. We enabled them to increase their financial capacity to implement their advocacy strategies through various policy and legal frameworks and spaces such as EAC SRH Bill, ICASA, domestic laws speaking to protection of rights of SSWs.

At least 2 feminist organisations, women’s rights and/or sexual rights CSOs and movements in Kenya and Uganda with enhanced skills and capacity to influence legal and policy processes and integrate feminist and human rights perspectives into their advocacy.

title.narrative: 2.1 Feminist movements work collectively with mainstream women’s rights, human rights, feminist, youth and SSW organisations to defend SSW's freedom of assembly and expression
2.1.1 Number of times LBT persons, sex workers, WHRDs, youth groups and feminist organisations and movements engage in collective action/advocacy to promote SSW's inclusion and defend SSW's rights.

comment.narrative: At least 1 times LBT persons, sex workers, WHRDs, youth groups and feminist organisations and movements in Kenya and Uganda engage in collective action/advocacy to promote SSW's inclusion and defend SSW's rights.
UHAI held the 16th Round of Peer Grants and SSW led organisations were funded to enable them to engage in concerted advocacy for the protection of their rights.

title.narrative: Number of initiatives developed by targeted feminists’ organisations and activists to strengthen the presence of targeted beneficiaries to participate in physical public spaces.

comment.narrative: At least 1 initiatives developed by targeted feminists’ organisations and activists to strengthen the presence of targeted beneficiaries to participate in physical public spaces.

UHAI provided funding to SSW organisations to enable them to carry out advocacy and awareness raising activities aiming to influence and educate stakeholders on the rights of SSWs to engage in public physical spaces
